DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study identify body 's response aerobic vs. resistance exercise . Throughout study , examine food intake , appetite , physical mental well-being , , aerobic resistance exercise .
DOC.brief_title: The Body 's Response Aerobic Versus Resistance Exercise
DOC.criteria: Body mass index 1829 kg/m2 Weight stable ( < 4.5 kg weight change within last 6 month ) Nonsmoking Constant habitual activity pattern within last 3 month Nondiabetic Resistive exercise training ( ≥ 2 time week ) base report physical activity level ( questionnaire ) Aerobic exercise training ( ≥ 2 time week , 30min session ) base report physical activity level ( questionnaire ) Confirmation acceptability eat study test food ( macaroni casserole ) Approved participate study study physician principle investigator The old subject must also meet follow eligibility criterion : Age range : 65 year old Body fat ( woman : < 38 % ; men : < 28 % ) Normal rest EKG assess Cardiologist The young subject must also meet follow eligibility criterion : Age range : 1829 year Body fat ( woman : < 28 % ; men : < 18 % ) Body mass index : outside 1829 kg/m2 range Gained lose > 4.5 kg within last 6 month Smoker ( currently within last year ) Intermittently involve diet and/or exercise program within last 3 month Clinically diagnose diabetic Did perform resistive exercise training ( currently within last 3 month ) base report physical activity level ( questionnaire ) Did perform adequate aerobic exercise ( currently within last 3 month ) base physical activity level ( questionnaire ) Study food find unacceptable consumption subject Unapproved participate study study physician principle investigator The old subject : Age range : < 65 yr Body fat ( woman : > 38 % ; men : > 28 % ) Abnormal rest EKG ( interpreted cardiologist ) assess ( study exclusion ) study physician , Arthur Rosen , MD The young subject : Age range : outside > 29 yr < 18 yr Body fat ( woman : > 28 % ; men : > 18 % )
DOC.keyword: The purpose study identify body 's response aerobic vs. resistance exercise
